newsitem.title: UK: Highland Distilleries down after results. [CORRECTED 10:55 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Highland Distilleries down after results. [CORRECTED 10:55 GMT]

text.p: Shares in Highland Distilleries Plc dropped in early trading on Monday after the Famous Grouse whisky maker posted profits at the low end of market forecasts.
The share price was down 6-1/2p at 332-1/2 by 0725 GMT, its lowest level since February.
Pre-tax profit dropped to 37.1 million (Corrects from 36.5 million) stg in the year ended August 31 from 42.9 million a year before.
Analysts had expected profits in a range between 39.2 million stg and 42.5 million, though the latest figure included 3.0 million stg in re-organisation charges.
"The profit was off and was below the lowest estimate," said one trader in the stock.

The company said the UK continued to be a very competitive market though there were indications that prices were moving up. It said the UK market for Scotch whisky had dropped four percent though overall market share for Famous Grouse rose slightly.
The dividend was raised to 6.3p per share from 6.0p.
